attributes.action: Review the issue of  justice and impartiality, within the Teaching Profession, when dealing with the present 'discplinary procedures' in place.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Recently, a teacher was reported to the police for 'inappropriate behaviour', with young men aged seventeen.
This is a serious 'Breach of Trust',as sited in the 'Act of 2003'. The young men were more concerned about not getting their teacher into trouble, than realising the 'serious nature' of the offence.
So they lied, and have twisted their stories in order to get the person who reported the inappropriate behaviour into trouble.

Consequently the case was handed over to the school, by the police.

Hereafter the 'judge and jury' are in fact the school.

The questions/documentation to be put to the Governors are decided by an 'Investigating Officer' chosen..by the school.

The documents to be given to the 'Governors' are picked by fellow teachers and so are the questions, selected by a member/s of staff.

WHERE is the impartiality in the process?

With this example in mind, and to avoid 'Kangaroo Courts' for other innocent people, then it is suggested that there is always an 'Independent Body' to adjudicate, in the interests of justice.
It would also restore the faith in the system, which is most certainly NOT playing on a 'level playing field', that is a fact.
